text:
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2017 375 ml bottle, bb 14-03-2026, shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Amber copper, clear body, with a small, frothy, off-white head. 
Aroma of barnyard, vinegar, red apples, wine, oak, some red berries, some citrus. 
Tastes quite similar, but with more acid, some unripe pears. 
Light, slick mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation. 
Finishes acidic, dry, wooden, a bit vinous, fruity, with apples, pears, 

Very nice. I really like the nose, which is very elegant, despite the acidic notes. Taste has more of the vinegary sour notes, while Its also nice. Not my favourite Tilquin, but a very nice, characterful one.
Ar/Ap/T/P/Ov: 8/4/7/4/16

0,375l bottle at home shared with Saeglopur from trade with Maracuja05, big thanks. Vintage 2013/2014, BB 14/03/2016. orange clear color, small white head. smells funk, cheese, grassy, bit citric, light green apples, light wood. very nice smell lovely cheese notes. full body, very soft pearly carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes citric, funk, cheese, grassy, light wood, very lightly nutty, some green apples. finishes quite dry and lightly sour with notes of cheese, grass and some wood. very nice one, nice dryness, lovely cheese notes, not overly complex but very good to drink, love the soft pearly carbonation.
Strong lambic Aroma. Bottle 2013-2014. Rather low carbonation. Soft taste. Overall light oude geuze. Could drink a whole bottle.
Odeur de lambic classique. Acidité en début mais pas trop prononcée. Le gout boisé devient dominant par la suite. Geuze assez douce

(Bottle, Beer Lovers Bar, Antwerpen, 18 May 2017) Golden amber colour with foamy, white head. Fruity, sourish nose with grapefruit, sour grapes, stable and sweaty horse. Fruity, tart taste with notes of grapefruit, sour green grapes, horse blanket, barnyard, musty cellar flavours and a dry and tart finish. More than medium body, dry. Tasty and very well balanced. Very nice.

URUS 3.0 #1
Aroma: hay, barnyard, slightly acidic, gooseberry, oak
Taste: moderate sour, tannic, hay, leather, barnyard, oak, gooseberry, some acidic, vinegar notes

Bottle from SB. Halfways clear amber color with a white head. Aroma of funk, citrus, barnyard. Very balanced sourness, a very long aftertaste lingering in the mouth. Not superdry but still dry. Supergood geuze, the aroma is really great.

375 mL bottle. Clear golden orange. Smells kinda malty, lemon, oak. Some vanilla and dried grass. Tastes surprisingly yogurty. Oaky throughout. Dried grass. Sweet maltiness. Oaky back end. Medium body. Low carbonation. Interesting take. Not a dry a lambic. I dont expect the yogurt flavor, but it isnt unwanted.
Bottle pour at ACBF2017. Pours hazy orange with white head. Fruity, citrus, grapes, funk, wood, moderate to high acidity. Nice balance, complex yet easy drinkable. Medium bodied.
Bottle. Clear yellow pour with a white head. Lemon zest highlights. Truth be told I drank too much of my poor while talking before starting to rate this beer. Really good body and mouthfeel.

Panelowo Rami Rami is drinking an Oude (Gueuze Tilquin)² à lAncienne (2013-2014) by Gueuzerie Tilquin at Saska Kępa

Jakos mniej, bo sciagajace takie, ale owocki i rownowaga nadal cacy. Malo dzikosci
UPDATED: APR 3, 2017 Rok 2013/2014. W zapachu owocowo, brzoskwinia, jabłko. W smaku jest naprawdę bardzo fajnie.
Moet ik ooit nog herproeven. Dit op Alvinne bierfestival gedronken. Aroma van damp paardendeken. Mooie oude smaak met paardebloem en paardenstal.

02-03-17 // 375ml bottle shared at Le Petit Belge Wiesbaden. Light hazy orange beer, minimal foam lacing. Tart and funky aroma. Taste is very dry, tart, green apples, sour, oaky, wood, smooth texture. Alcohol well hidden in a flavourful and complex Lambic. Well done.

Sampled from bottle at ACBF 2017. Slightly hazy, golden amber with a creamy, white head. Sourish-fruity, quite funky aroma of lemon, gooseberry, rhubarb and some barnyard. Moderately sour, quite funky and a bit fruity taste of lemon, gooseberry, rhubarb and oak, followed by a medium long, moderately tart, rather dry finish. Medium body, moderately astringent and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very good!
Säuerlicher, trocken hellmalziger Beginn. Weiche helle Säure auch im Mittelteil, spritzig, weich. Langer Nachhall, sehr ausgewogen. 10/11/12/12//12

Refrigerated 75 cl green bottle at the Sovern poured into a snifter. Clear deep golden with small white head. Aroma is tart, medium body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is sour citrus and some wood.

Bottle thanks Mortlach, grazie. Amber/orange hazy bright, minimal foam with lacing. Nose: apple skin, complexity of sour notes, cellar, mist. Mouth: super balanced, a bit sweeter than the regular gueuzes, citric a bit but rich in taste....round. Top
Bottle, thanks SirLimpsalot. Hazy golden/orange with a small white head. Aroma and taste of funk, apples, some oak and grapes. Fairly mild and medium tart. Smooth and easy to drink.
@Eddan 17-2-25: Mycket trevlig doft och smak med tydlig ton av vindruvor och fat. Lite beskeden syrlighet.

Bottle at home. 2011/2013. Pours a slightly hazy golden orange colour with a small off-white head. Fruity and sour aroma of rowanberries, oak, apple cider vinegar, barn yard, spices and flowers. The flavor is also both fruity and sour with oranges, peaches, lemon, vinegar, oak and forest floor. Has a slick and soft mouth feel, medium to full body and a light bitterness. A fantastic gueuze with an outstanding balance.

375ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy amber, white sparkling head that disappears quickly leaving a thin lid and no lacing. Tart and funky aroma, green apples, apple cider vinegar, oaky, cheese, grass and hay. Silky texture, smooth and tart, medium bodied, soft carbonation. Tart taste but not very funky, green tart apples, unripe plums, oaky, lemon zest, mild peppery, green cheese, minerals and hay. Crisp and dry finish. Great stuff!
Świetny lambik z gueuzerie Tilquin. Owocowy aromat, przede wszystkim brzoskwinie, cytrusy, tzw. horse blanket. W smaku kwaśne, cytrusowe, świetnie orzeźwiające, sesyjne, zbalansowane.
Bottle 75cl. Small white layer. Peach rose wine color. Aroma is flowers, rhubarb, raspberries, oak, wine. Taste is sour with touches of wood and wine.

Bottle shared at Grote Dorst. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is citrus, wood, cheese, apples. Taste has the Tilquin-typical bretty wood funk, with lots of straight citrus, cheese citrus pits, apples, quite some complexity. Some leafs. Bone dry finish. Carbonation is moussierend. Excellent!
Exquisite citrus and funk with some oak and moderate acidity. Compares really well to some of the best 3F blends.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Łódź panel #2 Piękne, eleganckie, subtelna acz wyrazista kwasowość. Szanuję.
Flaske 375ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsdalen. Delt med EgilB, Helge og Rune på Nerstranda 5 Jan 17. Aprikosfarget. Filmskum. Syrlig fruktaroma. Smaken syrlige epler. Tørr, treaktig ettersmak.

375ml dark green, cork and wire bottle kindly shared by Finn at a New Years gathering. Misty golden body, white layer at the surface. Yeasty dry fruitiness on the nose, almost dusty impression. Mixed mid-tart taste of oak, cheese, ripe lemon and cherry. Tart and dry to the ending. Fine bodied. Nice, still not my kind of great beer though (Tromsø 05.01.2017),

375 ml bottle shared by Dave - thanks again! Shouldve bought this when I saw it on shelves here and stupidly figured itd be around for a while, given the price and lack of heat on Tilquin at the time. Dum dum. Anyway, it pours a hazy dull goldwith minimal head. First impression is immediately reminiscent of 3F, with their sawdusty, grassy, dusty funk character, cobwebs, must, lemon juice, grapes, and oak. Light-medium bodied, with a musty, funky, slightly acetic, and earthy mouthfeel. Another excellent offering from Tilquin. Part of me is glad even the broader n00bish beer nerd community has come around on Tilquin, but part of me is sad I cant buy this stuff as easily anymore.

Heres to rating 4,100!
Pours a pretty lightly hazy golden color with a nice head & good lacing on the glass.

The aroma is pungent and funky with lots of oak, but also a nice soft fruit character with a mild lemon and cherry aroma. Unique.

The flavor is similarly unique.... very very dry with a lot of lemony sourness... but also very earthy & honestly not dissimilar to a fruitiness one would come to expect from a Chablis or maybe a fruit forward Riesling. The oak & mild bitterness make this a very bold
Gueuze but the soft accents make it very special. 
Amazingly as unique as this is from à lAncienne one thing that was not a noticeable difference was booziness, lovely.

Bottle at Moeder Lambic Original. Pours clear dark orange with a medium, frothy white head, long retention with light lacing. Aroma is oak, grapes, black walnuts, honey and cracker malt. Flavor is tart and earthy grapes, black walnuts, honey and cracker malt and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle from We Brought Beer, Balham. Colour is rich bright rusty orange in the glass, thin white head which dissipates to almost nothing. Nose is Sour, rich grains, toasted grain, acidic, farmyard, leather, fruity, apple cider, brown apple flesh, rubber. Taste is mildly sour and tart, bitter, little rubber, apple cider acidic. Its slightly milder than usual which goes against the higher ABV. The finish has a tartness that lingers though. Apple tannins on the tongue. Dry white wine vinous notes. Its got a deep finish but its surprisingly soft.

75cl bottle. Clear amber pour with a thin white head that disappears quite quickly. The aroma includes apple vinegar, barnyard notes, wood. The taste follows the same notes, with an addition of unripe white grapes, mineral components, a bit of salt and an interesting hop bitterness. Medium body, low carbonation and a sour and bitter finish.

Pours hazy copper with low white head. Aroma of green grapes, grass, bretta, light barrels, light citrus. Taste is crisp, rich tart balanced with a subtle sweetness, lingering light fruity mild sour finish. Light and crisp body with average carbonation.

Bottle. Pours darker amber orange with no foam. Scent is much fruitier with notes of cherry, brown sugar, black licorice, and berries. Taste is medium dense lambic with nice dry Merlot notes as well as flavors of banana and brown sugar, consistent with the scent. Very great.
Bottle at home. Pours deep orange, nose is vinegar, funky, citrus, toffee, taste is similar, dry.

Bottle @ Moeder original. Batch 2. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of barn, barn, green apples, citrus. Taste is very barne, a light tone of ace acidic, citrus and stone fruits, quite nice barn taste. Very balanced.
Bottle at Avenue Pub thanks to Eric. Pours clear dark gold. Peach, moldy foot, strong oak nose and flavor. Muted thick mouthfeel light sourness. Low carbonation.

Slightly hazy orange color with a bit of beige foam. Aroma has really nice barnyard notes, mostly hay and wood. Taste starts with fermented fruits, tart but not puckering, with nice lemon and bitter orange peel on the finish. Light body, quite dry and well carbonated. Really complex tasting but also balanced and easy to drink.

Świetny rustykalny aromat zagrody, siano, skóra, skórka cytryny, agrest, kwaśne jabłka, winogrona. Smak średnio kwaśny, mocno wytrawny ale nie taniczny. W smaku niedojrzałe owoce, agrest, cytryna, skóra. Oleista tekstura i nieźle ciało. Bardzo klasyczne i eleganckie gueuze.

A 375ml bottle at Moeder Lambic Fontainas with a neck label of 2011-2013 and a best before date of 29th January 2024. It was poured into a traditional Tilquin gueuze glass. It poured a slightly hazy golden orange colour with a half finger white head that dissipated almost immediately and left no lacing. Aromas of lemon zest, fresh lemons, tart, sour, passionfruit and funkiness. Tastes sour, tart, mango, passionfruit and funk. Light bodied with moderate to high spritzy carbonation. Overall a very nice and refreshing gueuze with great spritzy carbonation and funk.

A very Special taste nothing to compare to. Not citrus, not bitterness, lots of taste - but

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours deep orange with a small, staying creamy white head. Aroma has funk, light vinegar tartness, soft oranges, red apple, oak. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good maltiness, wheat, oak, vanilla, orange zest. Very elegant, very lovely.
Shared bottle at Aarons. Nose is funk and straw. Light in color. Some cheese. And very lambic in taste. Great stuff.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2016 Bottle @ In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst 12/6-16 [Vintage 2011]. Fruity and bretty with grapes and wood, also acidic. Body is medium, the finish is dry, bretty and fruity, also tart. Lovely!

Bottle served in a tulip. Pouring a beautiful deep orange with a fizzy off-white head of foam, it has an enticing aroma of peaches, nuts and a sweet bready character. To be honest it evokes a dense luscious danish, yum.

On top of that you also get a peppery oaky tartness. Its light bodied but has a sharp carbonation and pronounced acidity. 

The taste is really delicious, nutty, tart, oak, leather, lemon juice and I even get a kind of dense dark germanic bread sort of flavor while the finish is ascerbic and acidic. A happy find scoring this 2013 vintage.

Pours a somewhat hazy or murky orange with some foam settling along the edge of the glas. The nose has light leather, light lemon, light spicy esters, light lactic sourness, some sweet farmlike qualities too, a little of everything you want in a gueuze. The taste is rich in flavour but have everything in perfect ballance. Very minerally tart and very dry with a lemonskin aftertaste. Perfect mouthfeel imho. Carbonation is light but not absent. Like it a lot

A large shared 2011-2013 bottle at RBWG in Tampa, FL (from notes). 
Hazy pale yellow with a decent head.
Funky and fruity aroma with some pepper.
Complex fruity flavor with hints of white pepper, apricots, and lemons. Moderately funky.
A bit too bitter in the aftertaste but its mainly the funk that curtails my enjoyment.

Bottle at Fine Mousse. A cute story which ended up into a great beer albeit not very different from regular Tilquin. All the classy citrus goodness is there, along with the phenolic, earthy, hayish background. Bone dry, but heavier bodied than the regular Tilquin Gueuze, round and soft edged in spite of the usual champaigny bubbliness. Another stellar offering from what may very well be the best lambic blender.
Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours hazy golden orange with a white head. Slightly sour fruit aroma. Med body. Flavor is very gueuze. Tart/sour fruit. Quickly mellows. Its very nice indeed.

On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours cloudy golden with a modest beige head and a sour fruit aroma. There is a hearty fruit flavor that sticks to the palate. More body than the usual gueuze with a tart finish. An excellent blend.

Gueuze tilquin squared 2011-2013

Pours an amber-orange color with almost no head, but a small, white, bubbly film at the rim of the glass.

My room is filled with funk and barnyard aromas even before I put my nose into the glass. Huge oak and dusty earth presence, which balances the prominent funk, consisting of old, dried orange, green apple peel and blue cheese. Mushroom, old cheese rind and wet hay enhance the complexity on the nose, alluding to a great tasting beer.

Has a lower carbonation, which perfectly highlights the multi layered taste in this, with a funk defined tartness, finished by a mineral dry note, while the mouthfeel remains pleasantly soft and refreshing.

Orange peel from the nose is present on the taste, blue cheese and old, moldy malts as well. Its heavier body gets reflected in those qualities, which are off the chain, truly intense with a lot of further reaching accompanying flavors. Offers a musty, fruity sweet malt foundation, which results into a tooth numbing, sour dryness. Finishes with mushrooms, even more blue cheese, a mineralic softness and a pungent, malt coated tartness, which lingers on the tongue for quite a while.

Fantastic beer, this one convinces for its rich funkiness and balance, providing a great complexity, with everything staying in perfect balance. Its oaken wood and malt backbone makes this unique, highlighting the funk in the most pleasant way.
Shared bottle at Mandagsklubben 11.04.16. Dark golden. Small off-white head. Pure and complex aroma and taste of fine lambic. Dry and astringent. Excellent drinkability.

375ml bottle pours a dark orange with some creamy, white head. Nose has grapefruit rind, some nettles, barrel, funk, preserved lemon. Flavor is tart with grapefruit and passionfruit, lemon, nettles, sour barrel. Medium bodied finish.
Bottle from Lambicus. Hazy golden colour with white head. Fruity and dusty aroma. Sourt, fruity,apple, citric, dusty taste. Medium body.

Smakelijk Oude Gueuze Oranje kleur
 Verfrissend zuur Licht koolzuur Eikenhout Dorstlessser Lekker!
Bottle. Poured a golden color with an averaged sized head. Funky, fruity, barnyard, citrus, and some wood. Very nice.

Drunk from 37,5 bottle bought from Malting Pot in Brissels. Sharp, tart geuze.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great example of the traditional style. Nose was full of cheesy funk, as was the flavor to a lesser degree. Some lemon and green olive as well.

Sampled July 2015
Pours from the bottle with a thin pale tan head. Pale amber color. The aroma smells of musty mushrooms, musty, oak wood, a bit of urine even, a hint of cider, as well as some dried straw / weed, pale grain character and pale cracker notes. Basically this smells like a perfect Gueuze at this moment.

Aggressively sour, though not too bracingly, lots of musty notes, a bit of urine character, musky barnyard funky notes, and a finish that is woody, slightly astringent, and aged-hop bitter. A touch of cider character adds some fruitiness, and some tart, green, not quite ripe fruit notes. A touch of chemical character that is not quite plastic, not really cleaner, but subtly piquant.

A great Gueuze, that I am thoroughly enjoying. Hits the right notes, especially at this right moment.

Bouteille 375ml, gracieuseté de Beervana lors du CanBIF Spring 2015, Thanks Cameron! Couleur orangée à peine voilée, mousse blanche évanescente laissant un anneau sur les parois du verre. Arôme de levures sauvages, alcool, fruité, un peu poussiéreux, Brett fermier. Goût de pommes mûres, Brett, bonne acidité, alcool, légère astringence, amertume moyenne. Carbonatation élevée, corps moyen.

Pours bit hazy, bit of foam. Aroma is strong and horse-blankety. rotten apples. Taste feels light but funk is strong and some apple juice essence lingers down there as well. Refreshing still, real Belgian stuff, they know what is lambic.

375ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours cloudy yellow with a tiny and quick fading white head. Aroma is barnyard, hay, citrus, oak, green apples, lemon zest and slightly earthy. Flavour is medium sour and light sweetness. Medium bodied, thin texture, average carbonation. Finish is oak, slightly herbal and sour.

2011 Vintage Bottle at home, 16th January 2016. Pours a dark amber, very fine bubble head. Aroma is sour funk, honey and lemon, damp wood. Taste is gooseberry tart, cellar, acidic, refreshing lemon sherbet. Higher ABV for me makes this less easy drinking. Complex and enjoyable
Bottle->tulip. Hazy orange/gold with moderate frothy white head. A: citrus, barnyard, yeast. T: same, tart and funky. Awesome.
Golden color, white head. Floral nose, apple, citrus, sour notes, funk. Sour taste, fruity notes, astringent, lime, bitter lime peel. Medium body, average carbonation.

(750ml bottle) cloudy orange, nice bubbles on the glass. Nose of light wood char, slightly sweet, slight funk, cellar, moss, lemon. Taste is more bright than the nose. Lemon, zesty, touch of caramel, dry, funky and earthy Brett. Nice medium carbonation and body. Great earthy linger on the palate.
Bottle. Great aroma, gooseberries, lots of funk. Spiky. Taste is great, very funky, minerals, light grapefruit, really nice. Prickly. Dusty. Great.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2016 Thanks shoulderbroken for sharing the bottle! 

Poured into a wine glass of 2013 vintage in 2015, showing cloudy, translucent, deep yellow with half a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose is of intense farmyard, brett, dried apricot and a very high tartness.

The palate is fully carbonated and medium bodied. Moderately tart with flavors of light cannabis and apricot. It is difficult to describe but what stands out is without a doubt the tartness, it is complex, brilliant, and bright yet restrained with a slight astringency. Fantastic.

Hazy amber golden color. Massive barnyard, earth, cobwebs with subtle fruitiness. Wow, this nose is like a home run wrapped into a hattrick. The mouth is fairly sour, with lots of cobwebs and barnyard. Drinks very light. Long lemons and barnyard finish. Best beer from them.

Bottle @ La Palma Sour Fest 2015. Hazed lighter orange pour with white foam. A good bit of lemon zest and juice along with some green apple and grape. Pretty musty and funky, too. A bit of mushroom and some wet dirt. Slight sweetness of bread and dried stone fruits. Juicy citrus fruits on the tongue. Pretty nice stuff.

had in bottle a couple of times.. . dark amber .. beatiful head and lacing .. . hay, dirty earth, perfume whiffs, hay, and horse .. plucky and refreshing, very deep, and something i wish i had bought more of .. . . are cacti like sex dolls for porcupines or do you think theyre not even turned on by them?

Dank, barnyardy funk. Citrus green apples and applepeel. Flavor is intensely fruity, sour. Funky with flavors of applepeel, sour green apples, apple candy with a nice spritzy dry finish with bread and grains. Delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

37,5 cl bottle @ home, BBE 29.01.2024
Aroma has earthy notes, strong grapefruit and mild toffee notes. Flavour is tart with earthy notes, grapefruit, some gastric acid and mild lactic notes. Cannot taste the higher ABV here.

375 ml bottle. BBE 29.01.2024.
Pours clear amber color with a small head. Aroma is rowan berries and hay, some herbal notes with yeast and wood, some earthy notes too. Flavor is tart apricot and rowan berries, gooseberries and some wood. Very dry sour palate. Nice.
3345

375 ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden amber colour with a small foamy head. Aroma is very strong on sour apricot, rowanberries and grapefruit. Flavour of heavy sour rowanberrier, grapefruit, a bit of vinegar, earth, tart wood and a bit of lactic notes. Mild sweetness. Medium bodied. Dry and sour finish. Nice and enjoyable.

375ml bottle from Saveur-Biere

Pours dark orange with a small head. Aroma of sour berries, oak, earthy notes, funky yeast, moldy cellar and wood. Taste is sour, earthy and funky with loads of tartness, earthy notes, hints of oak and vanilla. Finish is sour, funky and earthy with hints of oak, berries, and wood. Quite intense.

Hazy golden with small white head. Citrus, funk, earth, spice and blood orange. Tart, crisp, floral and mineral finish. Overall: What a brew! I hear that people in australia smelled when i opened this bottle.

Probada en The Jeffrey, New York. Sabor muy fuerte a limón y naranja. Aroma amaderado y cítrico, con toques de manzana. Es una cerveza cara, para mi no lo vale aunque no pueda negarse su calidad.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours hazy fizzy golden with tiny white head. Aroma is dusty, fruity funk, fruity brett and grapes, bready hay and barnyard. Taste has more sour peach, dusty, sweet peach, grapes, really sour, white wine. Oaky, apricot, and awesome thin body. Lime. Grapes in finish and oaky tannins. Light dry. No way this is 7,6 abv...
12.7 oz bottle. Barnyard/hay flavor followed a sour strawberry nose. Sold bite - will be interesting to see how this develops.
Bottle shared with adnielsen and bnielsen13. Thanks Aaron! Pours a hazy golden color with white head. Funky, barnyard, orange, oak aromas. Sour, funky, fruity, lemon flavors. Fuck yeah!
Bottle. Clear golden body with a medium white head. Yeast, basement, funk, bitter, grapefruit, cobwebs. Very well balanced. Great.

Bottle @ Grill n Chill. Thanks to lukaduke! Fairly clear, golden orange appearance with a foamy tan head. Aroma is all dusty hops, Parmesan cheese, lemon, cobwebs. Authentic aroma. Moderate plus carbonation. Dry, low sweetness. Low to moderate bitterness. A hint of booze but doesnt taste high boost. Tons of dust, cobwebs, corn crib notes. Not overly sour. Fucken good.
what a great mistake, strong carb now! Lots of funk both strong and light. Tons of barnyardy-funky- flavors. Great stuff!

Poured from a 375 ml bottle. Aroma is very nice with a light acidity and citrus note. Moderate earthy and herbal notes with some medium light oak. Light stone fruit skins. The herbal and earthy notes really shine. Pours a hazy, golden copper with a medium sized, moderately thick, slightly off white head that slowly recedes. Light lacing and small legs. Flavor is slightly sweet with a moderate, but soft acidity with hints of citrus. Quite a bit of oak in the flavor; definitely more than in the aroma. Light mineral notes. Medium light earthy and herbal notes. Light bitterness. The oak chaarcrer works really well with the herbal and earthy notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. Overall, this is a very enjoyable beer. It isn?t quite as bright as it could be, but it had great oak and herbal notes. Acidity is well balanced and not sharp at all.

(375ml "2011-2013" bottle from Malt Attacks, Brussels, July 26th 2015) Pours a very hazy deep gold with a tiny ring of bubbles and no lace. Nose is surprisingly rich and fruity with notes of Asian pear, green apple, lemon, grapefruit, something like peach/apricot. Some acetone, lacto sourness with vinegar in support, a sweaty sort of funk. Wood is weaker than expected. Flavour is exceptionally fruity, quite sour with a real citrus edge, lactic at the start. Cider vinegar fills in for a more complex sourness. Apple and pear flesh up front too. Grape skin towards the finish with lots of oak, hay and light horseblanket. The puckering citrus and acidic notes remain all the way through and balance the tannic, astringent dryness from the wood. Feels fairly substantial for a gueuze, fullish of body and rich from wood and malt, but also still lively from fruitiness. Light carb. Great beer. Maybe it started as an accident but it ended as by far my favourite Tilquin, layered, balanced, full of flavour.

375 ml bottle into tulip glass; 2013 vintage bottled on 1/29/2014. Pours slightly hazy orange/amber color with a 2 finger dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big lemon, lime, grapefruit, orange peel, green apple, pear, white grape, white vinegar, pepper, leather, oak, wheat, cracker, hay, straw, grass, musty funk, and yeast/oak earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak barrel, and moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big lemon, lime, grapefruit, orange peel, green apple, pear, white grape, white vinegar, pepper, leather, oak, wheat, cracker, hay, straw, grass, musty funk, and yeast/oak earthiness. Moderate amount of fruity/earthy tartness and peppery spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, lime, grapefruit, orange peel, white vinegar, pepper, leather, oak, wheat, cracker, hay, straw, musty funk, and yeast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak, and moderate pale malt flavors; with a great malt/tart/spiciness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately acidic, and lightly crisp/sticky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an incredible gueuze style. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak barrel, and moderate pale malt flavors; and very smooth to sip on with the balanced acidity. Just as impressive as the normal with increased oak and Brett intensity; and a little more malt presence. A highly enjoyable offering.

2/21/15. 750mL bottle thanks to Homer321 during RBWG 2015. Golden orange pour with a nice frothy off-white head, good lacing. Great aroma, funk, vanilla, oak, complex sourness, basically everything I love in real oaked sours. Great flavor, sour, funk, barnyard, oak, vanilla, delicious. I wish this werent so expensive so I could buy a ton.

2011-13 date on the bottle (14 vintage?) from 375ml bottle, thanks to berntholer! Pours an apricot yellow with a white head which quickly fizzes away. Aroma is lactic (sour dairy), citric acid, freshly-cut lime and some barnyard funk. Taste is peaches, apricots, green grapes, yogurt and oak barrel on the finish. Dry finish. Sour but not punchy, commensurately fruity-sweet and sour. Finish is somewhat abrupt.

Bottle from Tanakaya shared at a tasting. Slightly hazy light copper with a small head that dissipates fairly quickly. Big sour aromas with some yogurty notes as well: peach, pear, plum, lemon zest and wood all present. Taste is more of the same with a wonderful creamy rich mouthfeel. The fruit really stands out. Good tartness with a nice sour finish that lingers.

Bottle from Belgium. Pours a cloudy orange with little to no head. Aromas of bacterial funk from transvestite hookers. Funky, lactic taste. Pretty dry. 
Semi sweaty armpits. Good, not God nectar.

The beer is a light golden amber color. Fairly cloudy, which is probably my fault. Medium, fizzy white head. The aroma is deep and rich with sour, lambic funk. Lots of fruit - lemon, oak, pear, peach, grape. Musty with some lactic flavor. Nice lactic sourness in the taste. More of the same fruity funk. Medium-light sour. Its a big, rich gueuze. Very good. Full feel with some effervescent bubbliness.

botella. @El Cabanón, Avilés 17/07/2015
Color dorado, espuma blanca, aromas acidos.

On June 22, 2015. Marked "2011-2013", 37.5 cl bottle. Thanks to fiulijn!Hazy golden color, white head. Acidic, tart taste. Tart mouthfeel, no bitterness. Tart, funky scent. Tart aftertaste.Perhaps I didnt find it overly complex, but I did find it very tasty!

Bière dégustée sur la terrasse du Moeder Lambic. Merci Jean! Cette bière orangée et trouble présente une mousse mince mais persistante formée de grosses bulles agrippés sur les abords du verre, et dune mousse légère et fongique au centre. La mousse centrale semble très active! Au nez, les lambics sont modérés. Je ressens un peu de Brettanomyces sauvages mais tempérées, des effluves de bois, des fruits tel le raisin vert, le tout dans un ensemble plutôt vineux. Je ressens de lalcool tant au nez quen bouche. La deuxième phase de fermentation en baril a-t-elle été trop longue? Cette Gueuze manque déquilibre à mon avis. Loin dêtre mauvaise, mais je la trouve quelque peu difficile à boire.

Bottle from Brewery Creek, Vancouver, cork2011-2013, bb 30/01/2024, 7.5%Hazy light Amber color. The aroma of Lambic is pungent, full of aromas of cellar, horseblanket, lemon; intense. Dry but still with good body; good orange peel flavor, astringent, strong character.Excellent.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy dark golden body with a medium bubbly white head, disappearing after a short while. Aroma is red fruits, prunes, dry horse blanket notes, barnyard funk and hints of hay, spices and oak tannins. Taste is barnyard funk, bready malt tones, oak, hay, citrus, red fruits and hints of grape peel, apple vinegar and lime zest. Light to medium body, high carbonation. More body and also a more protruding malt base than most geuzes, but really nice; spicy, fruity and sour at the same time. A bit of an oddity, but a fantastically tasty beer for sure. One of the better sours Ive had in a while.

Bottle shared with oakbluff. Vibrant light orange in colour with medium spritzy carbonation. Potent aromas of lemon rind, barnyard, and driftwood. Flavors are funky and tart with a fleshy stone fruit and mild woody component in the background. Definitely heavier in the mouth than a regular strength gueuze, but with more than enough acidity and carbonation to keep it refreshing.
Quite awesome, although the added alcohol heat detracts from the greatness. Nice lacto profile though.

375, capped. Pours a clear and fairly dark brown with a loose light tan head that goes away. Big oak on the nose, lots of puckery balsamic and lemon as well. Creamy medium body with soft carb. Piercing tartness, lots of oak on the mid palate, but beautifully balanced. Dry, oaky finish.
2011/2013 bottle. Deep gold, good carbonation. Old hops, sweat, light pineapple, horse blanket. Juicy, especially for a gueze. Mouth watering sour, lemon. Very tart but balanced at the same time.

0,375l fles gedeeld doet Lion en bryan. Goudgeel met een witte kraag. Geur met gefermenteerd fruit, sinaasappel.Smaak is mooi vol met wederom sinaasappel en een trekkende afdronk, champagne achtig. Erg lekker en niet te zuur, mooi in balans
Plus concentrée et complexe que la précédente, également plus longue et plus profonde, puissante et équilibrée. Un régal absolu.

Tilquins geuze but fermented a second time, resulting in a considerably higher ABV than usual for the style. Curious about this one... Beautiful, warm deep orangey colour (probably a tad darker than the regular, which may have to do with the higher ABV), misty with champenoise sparkles, under a medium, egg-white, moussy head with moderate retention. Musty and funky aroma of lemon, unsweetened yoghurt, dusty cellar, sulphur, wet cardboard, damp earth, ripe apricot, botanical roses, starfruit, dry sherry, hint of tobacco, hay, dried parsley and a subtle but clear animalistic smell of wet leather, stale sweat and even chicken broth, but fitting into the whole and in that sense not even disturbing, only adding lambic funkiness the way I like it. Taste starts with a vivid estery fruitiness of sour berries and unripe stonefruit mixed with a sharp lemon acidity, drying the mouth but tantalising the salivary glands; a dusty, powdery, almost starch-like mouthfeel appears as well, enlightened by the carbonation. The complete and pure lambic profile shines in all its glory: soft wheat sourishness, light bready malts in the background, all drenched in a complex play of sour and musty, with a leathery Brett effect in the finish, along with the expected persisting drying acidity, slightly bitter, earthy hops providing closure, and wood accents. The alcohol remains completely hidden. Bone dry (and therefore very appetizing!), full, completely satisfying geuze, perhaps a bit deeper than the regular version. Excellent.

Golden body, mild haze, small white head. Mineral, funk, well water, citric goodness with an aggressive, yet elegant finish. Bold and delicious. Yeah man. This is fantastic.

Bottle courtesy of James at the marathon tasting, may 16th. Pours a bright orange with white lacing. Mouthfeel is bright and active with notes of bright funky peach, apricot, fruit skins, funk and barn. Light oak. Awesome.

37,5cl bottle shared @BKL 15. Truly a superlative Oude Geuze in both amped intensity and ABV: its sparkling deliciousness radiates from the bottle immediately upon uncorking, inviting the nose to: lemon-rind infused cider, champagne green apple, subtle oak, young aceto balsamico bianco, unripe kiwi, gooseberry. A difficult beer for my palate - very dry on the the tongue - very oaky aftertaste - almost cider like - a bit much for me.

Big thanks to Taylor. Bright orange with fluffy white head that dissipates quickly. Barnyard funk and hay. The aroma is potent. Wow this is big funk dry sour. This beer might be a bit to tannic and astringent.
Shelfy bottle at RBWG GT. nose is super fruity with a light tartness. Taste is similar with a moderate chest burn. Some fleshy fruit like peach. Light alcohol warning too. Very nice.

Pours a deep golden color with an off white head. The smell is wood, funk, nice citric acidic notes. The taste is ad it smells ending dry, woody and citric. Light+ body with fine carbonation.

February 6, 2015. Bottle at home. 
Light hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is tart apples, barnyard, lemon, leather, oak. Taste is sour and fruity green apple and citrus, funky barnyard, earthy, finish is dry and tart with funky apple notes. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation.

375mL bottle, pours a cloudy orange with a small, quickly-dissipating white head. Bottle from saveur-biere.com. Appearance is cloudy orange. Thin persistent head. Body is crispy but still smooth. Taste is medium sour, light sweet and medium bitter. Aroma is super fruity, hop, wood. What a beast!

Borefts Beer Festival 2013. Hazy orange with a small white head. Funky and quite fruity aroma with apricot, mango, pineapple and oranges. Dry and tart, fruity flavour with great complexity and lots of fruit. Drier and more tart than the regular à lAncienne

Bottle thanks to Tad. Cloudy golden with short lasting head. Funky sharp lemon aroma. Taste of funky lambic, sharp. Extremely sour. D-lish
Bottle at Craigs. Pours hazy gold with a thin white head. Aromas of sour funk, sherbet, sharp lemon. Taste is more of the same. Finishes sour.

Bottled. Pours hazy golden with a large off-white head. Aroma of barnyard, horse blanket caramel, wood notes, orange and citrus. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carb. A great Sour.

.375 bottle. Orange hazy. Malty orange peel, barnyard, light funk. Really just everything I love in gueuzes. Tart dry body, med full, malty feel. Super nice gueuze. Has all the flavours, good sturdy body. Excellent.-- bb

37.5cl bottle. It pours a clean ripe apricot color with a small white hea that fades away immediately. Aroma is intensely sour and acidic with citric notes and light funk and barnyard. Taste is again very sharp lemony and acidic with more light cheesy funk. Light to medo bodied with good carbonation. Finishes acidic and citrusy. Overall, good Gueuze, more similar to a Cantillon blend with the harsh lemony acidity, far from the funky complexity of a fine Drie Fonteinen.

Bottled 01/14/2014. This is the USA Export 75CL bottle. Paid $25 for it and split 2 ways @ 44 degrees F. This sat upright for a whole month. Looking forward to this one. 

A - Very dark orange, 2 finger bubbly head that faded fast on a very clear pour of zero sediment. 

S - The nose is unlike any Gueuze Ive ever had. Kiwi, mango, tropical fruits, light blue cheese funk, a lot of oak but overall just a hugely bright acidic fruit forward nose. The nose itself is a perfect 10. 

T - The taste is also just as fruity as the nose. Its quite funky but nothing surprising for a 2011 bottling and the obvious addition of more oak is really pleasant and appreciated. I get lemon and lime zest but only faintly. Its as if they took an Oude Gueuze, added more tannic red wine elements and a touch of cognac and then threw in a ton of fruit adjuncts. 

M - Crisp and light, nothing too intense but it is far less carbonated than a standard Tilquin Gueuze but no way near flat. 

O - Very impressive beer. I want more and more of this and Pierre, please continue to make this if you can. Incredible beer.
750ml green corked and caged bottle. This is awesome a truly select batch of Tilquin, has the same basic flavor but an amplified effervescence and dry body.

Flaska från Etre Gourmet. En storleken större geuze men fortfarande lika torr, stram, krispig och men en knivskarp syra utan uns av vinäger. Torra syrliga äpplen, fat, citrus, fat och en stor dos funkig hästfilt. Riktigt riktigt gott.

Bottle at Borefts day1 26/09/2014. Bodegraven. Onioon skin / orange coloured pour with a small fine off white head. Aroma is rubber / latex, sour with some fruits, acidic. Flavouris composed of acid sour, onion, some spicy orange =. Palate is scidic sharp acid with highish carbonation. Some woody tanin.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2015 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours vibrant orange with a small white head around the top. Nose shows those fantastic acidic characteristics I love in Tilquins stuff. Plenty of citrus, tropical juice and plum in front of that acidic funk. The taste is a perfect balance between tropical sweetness, juicy funk and acidity. The acidity cuts right through to the finish. Bloody tasty stuff. Would have to have a side by side to figure out which of the two is better I think but this is a seriously good beer

Bottle 750ml. Thx Tommy.
Pours slightly hazy golden with low-medium white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of barnyard, citrus, wood, menthol. Taste is of sourness, barnyard, citrus, intense wood, some acid. Palate: Very woody mouthfeel. Light-medium body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Very nice.

bootle.musty dusty leathery funk is fun. big lemon citrusy character. bit of cheese xloth. leather cowhide, citrusy grapefruit reminds of 3Fontame. acid is tamed down. a pleasant dryness. 7.6 booze not noticed. seems pretty oop.

75cl bottle shared by tom10101, thanks Tom! Pours a really hazy orange with a small white head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of funk, hay and cheese. Taste is of citrus/lemon, really oaky and moderately tart. Body was medium and carbonation a bit soft but still medium. Wood tannins. Overall a nice one, I wasnt convinced by their story at first but in the end it is a really nice gueuze!
Bottle from saveur bier. Hazy orange color, white head. Aroma is sour apples, fruits. Taste is sour apples, other fruits, stables, earth.

Bottle 750ml @ Christianssand Brygghus, Kristiansand
Pours slightly hazy deep golden with a small off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, tart, barnyard and some fruitiness. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium to heavy sour with a long dry, sour and fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle 750ml. corked. [ As Oude (Gueuze Tilquin)² à lAncienne ].Unclear medium yellow orange color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy horse blanket, barnyard, leather, funky, tangy citric sour, earthy, musty wood. Flavour is moderate sweet and light acidic with a long duration, grape - citric, fruity, tart, barnyard, lovely funky. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft to flat. Need more of this lovely beer ... a very very nice winner :D [20141101]

Bottle @ Pizzeria Paradiso, split with travlr. Light Amber pour with a small head. Nose is hugely strong. In your face cheese rind. Dish cloth and dried wood. Lemony underarm. Pollen covered coffins. Awesomely characterful aroma. The taste is just a step down From the perfect complexity of the aroma. Tangy lemon sherbet with a earthy Swiss cheese rind. Super dry finish. Soft carbonation, light body. Interesting stuff. Definitely among the best-smelling beers Ive ever had.

Bottle courtesy of jackl, a huge thanks! Slightly hazy golden color, white edge head. Really nice aroma if dusty and sweaty blankets left in hayloft corners then dragged through barns. Taste is dusty, peppery hay and straw. Carbonation is very subtle. It worked!

Bottle. Orange pour. Nice tart gueze aromas, wild, fruit, moderate tart tones. Flavors include woody, tart, light fruit, other wild tones. Doesnt let on that there is more alcohol in this then the original.
Drunk with stoutnick. Mild pepper aroma, with a lime zest tang. Feels good in the mouth, expect a mild pucker.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2015 Peach orange hues. Smells minerally - some mild funk. Taste is citrus heavy and strong mineral quotient. Sticks around on palate but not ridiculous. Good stuff, but neither better nor worse than their classic Gueuze.
Bottle. Pours yellow gold white head. Nose/taste of cheesecloth, lemon, funky farmhouse, oak, lemon acid. Medium body.

750 ml bottle shared by my fried Josh. Thanks! Pours a hazed gold with a white head of foam. Decent retention. The aroma has more funk than the other version. I get tropical fruits in here like mango and papaya. The taste is softly sour with fruity sweetness. Medium body and higher carbonation. Pretty damn good.

Bottle, 75cl corked. A hazy golden-orange beer with some bubbles on top. The aroma has a soft farmyard touch, with citrus peel and an almost fruity sugary touch. Its tart on the palate, full to medium bodied, with a soft carbonation. Quite fruity flavor, with a little sweetness and a touch of bitterness. Funky finish. Overall, a nice beer indeed, but it feels somehow too sweet and it seemingly lacks the complexity of the regular one. 141206
Bottle at Borefts. Pours orange, no head. Aroma is acid, grapes, oak. Taste: big body for gueuze, quite bitter, not too sour, tart. Fantastic.

375ml from Downer Wine and Spirits. Pouts a deep, clear amber color with a white head. Aroma is oak, funky, earthy, grass. Medium on the palate with soft carbonation. Flavor is lightly sour, citrus, lemon, oak, some bready sweetness, with an excellent sweet-tart finish. Very nice. Definitely bigger than the regular Gueuze.
Bottle. Golden-orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is vineous, fruit, barnyard. Flavour is sourness,fruit,barnyard, wood. Very nice beer.

Bottle shared at Billys sess, pours hazy golden with small whit head, not much lacing. Tasting 3 years old, and really horsed out, 3 font gueuzy. Medium bodied with a puckery layered finish. Banging.

Pours a hazy gold from the bottle with bubbly white head that lasts and leaves light lace. Aroma is musty funk, sour wine and oak notes, nice malty backbone. Taste is more of the awesome Belgian gueuze funk you expect from this brewery. A happy accident I would say, good carbonation, great balance, amazing beer.
Dark yellow cloudy with medium whit head. Soury-sweet aroma. Nice sour taste with rich mild bitterness, quite citrusy. Perfectly balanced with certain sweetness.

Bottle, 11/23/2014. Pours an orange amber color, medium fluffy white head fades to patchy haze on the surface. Aroma is musty, cheesy funk, mild fruitiness with more pronounced sour lemon, damp wood and earth. Taste is lemon, sour peach, funk and wood in the middle, lingering sour grapefruit bitterness.Medium light body, moderate acidity doesnt overwhelm. Very nice geuze.

Pour a lot like urine the day after a heavy night of drinking with the best of your homies. - Dark unfiltered apple juice, with no head. 
Aroma is like the sensation of stomach acid in the mouth after a good puke. Green apples, slight leather, oak, lemon, sour drops. Bitter taste of dirty pussy. The taste of all you ever gonna need. 
Good night.

Bottle. Light hazy golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of mineral, lemon peel, apple skin, light funk, wood and light lacto. Taste is dry and medium to high sour with notes of lemon peel, apple skin and light funk. Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Great gueuze. Complex.

First of all : thank you wild yeast! Isn't it fantastic to have organic surprises like this? The second oak barreling thanks to over saturation makes the Tilquin very rich in aromas.. almost floral! Waw! Balanced acidity, viscosity gone up, richer in aroma. Pours a murky Amber with fizzle sounds but no airy head like the normal version : great! Full accent now on taste! Oak scent, brown sugar aroma, a stickier and thicker texture. Lovely is an understatement. Great to experience a second version of one of my favourite gueuzes. "It's alive!!" :)

Bottle purchased from the Tilquin stand at Festibiere Gembloux, enjoyed at my leisure at home. Lovely pop from the cork, rich amber colour, plenty of carbonation bringing a good white head. Aroma is rich wet oak, autumn leaf mould funk, lemon, barrels, tartness in evidence before it hits the tongue. Prickles on the tongue with lemon juice, acid drops, cheesy funk and wood, all balanced out and intensely drinkable. Dry on the finish, with more wood barrel. Beautiful, intense gueuze.

Lightly hazy golden-amber body, medium sized white head, soapy lacing. Huge musty and cheesy quality in both the nose and flavor. Followed by some citrus, earth, and minerality. Medium bodied with lively carbonation and moderate acidity throughout. A little too much cheese for me as it tends to reduce the complexity of the profile. Hopefully this develops more depth with time.
375 ml bottle. Light amber pour with tiny lacings on top. Hay, barnyard, leather, apple skin, vanilla, lemon juice and a mellow funkiness. Good stuff!

26th September 2014Borefts VI. Bottle. Hazy amber beer, no real head. Palate is light and crisp. Pretty typical geuezy sourness. Wet wood, dried fruits, little lemon acid. Light finish. Its fine but I am utterly bemused at the all the excitement here.

750 ml bottle to stemmed taster. Looks good; a cloudy apricot with ample light bubbly head. Smells tart, funky, and oaky with notes of horse blanket. Tastes like it smells with a medium-bodied mouthfeel. Great beer.

Bottle: Opaque, burnt golden color with a chunky & foamy, off-white head that settles quickly to a thick collar. Huge sourness in the aroma, saliva inducing. Granny Smith apples, lemons, pear, acidic mineral water, lacto yeast, wet hay, mild sweaty funk, some dripping wet & tannic woody notes buried underneath. Wow. More wood comes through in the flavor; lots & lots of oak, but pleasantly so. Not overly tannic or astringent at all. Sour as hell. Puckering. Lemon, stone fruits, apple, hints of lactic acid, barnyard hay, wood, & sweaty yeast. Dry finish with finishing notes of tart apple & wood. Fantastic gueuze. Tilquin is one of my favorites, Ive always believed it was overlooked & underrated. This is very similar, perhaps a little more sour in the aroma, more woody in the flavor. Absolutely lovely.

375ml bottle in a stem glass. Pours hazy golden/amber with an off-white head. Aroma of funkiness and light tartness, some light oak, pale malts, and more funk. Flavor the same with the barnyard and funky notes dominating with a nice tart finish. Average texture. A really solid beer.
Bottle thanks to Chow. Pours a cloudy orange with small frothy white head. The aroma is more funk than regular version, oak. Medium mouthfeel with nice tartness, oak, funk, easy to drink, very nice.

375 mL bottle, big thanks to Nitze for opening this up!! Pours an opaque orange-gold pour with small bubbly head. Nose and flavor are lovely, with big sweet apricot, tangerine, and peach laying down a baseline for waves of earthen and basement funk to fold in upon. Low to medium carbonation, and can definitely feel the slightly higher alcohol on the palate, with a touch more tackiness and richness coming through. Beautifully funky and fruit forward. Delicious.
Bottle from 2011. Dank, pepper, jalapeño? Light mouthfeel, sharp and spicy. Pear. Sour and dry. Lemons balls. Great Gueuze!
Sampled @ Brassigaume 2014. More sour than the Quetsche, still a pleasant gueuze packing quite a punch. Very good.

375ml Bottle. Amber gold pour with a subtle hazy and a bubbly white head. Aroma of layered yeast funk, hibiscus, floral notes, lemon acidity, oak, with lactic acid. Tart acid throughout the flavor profile with yeast character taking the back seat, nice floral, earthy touch to it with the hibiscus character coming up again as well. Bubbly carbonation with a tart finish. Pretty solid, interested to see how this does in a few years.

(Oude (Gueuze Tilquin)² à lAncienne) From a bottle at Borefts 14.Slight hazy body,golden bright yellow in colour. Small and thin white head, minimal retention and lacing.
Nice aroma with sour ntes, floral, sour grapes, berries.
Taste is nicely sour, floral notes, berries, grass, grapes.
Medium thin body, lively carbonation, tart on the palate but not extremely so. 
Sour beers are not my thing but this was very god.
750ml Bottle. Frothy, white head. High Carbonation. Wheat and lemongrass. Finishes semi dry. No overwhelming tartness but has a nice light pucker.

Bottle courtesy of Elard. Poured a hazy medium Amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is acid light yeast light vinegar. The flavour is acid sour with a yeasty citrus mineral sour palate. Light bodied witn lively carbonation.

Sample courtesy of a friend.
thìn white head. Funky aroma. Cloudy blond pour. Quite decent
Tasted @ BBF 2014. Very sour brew, which I usually avoid. The brett is however really nicely balanced in this one which makes it very well drinkable.

375ml. Pours a hazy orange golden color with a finger of gaseous eggshell foam. Nose is citrus pith, soft stonefruit, touch of musky basement, mushroom. The palate is juicy and round with loads of citrus, sour oranges, tangerine, nectarine, hint of vanilla even. Lingering bitter citrus pith. Carbonation is light but works well with the body and flavors. Really enjoyable !

Tasted it at Festibière 2014 in Gembloux. Cloudy amber color. The barrel ageing is clear with obvious wooden aroma and flavor. Together with woodiness, notes of tangerine and orange make a beautiful combination. Traditional sour finish. The higher abv is also obvious but not bothering. Its a great beer. Too bad they probably wont make it anymore.
Draught at Borefts BeerFest 2014. Cloudy yellow - white head. Nice mellow sourness, gooseberries, nice wooden, fruity notes, funky, citric, some barnyard notes.

Bottle at home. It pours hazy orange with a quickly dissipating white head. The nose is earth, barnyard, wet wood, must, tangy tangerine, orange squash, Granny Smith apple and sherbet. The taste is smooth, tart, tangerine, orange marmalade, stone fruits, damp wood, floral, leaf, earth, sherbet, grapefruit, pomello, peach, vanilla, alcohol warmth and light acidity with dry, citrussy finish. Medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Great mouth-pucker and rather lovely tangerine character. Nice depth. Another winner from Tilquin.

Bottle. Not quite clear deep gold pour with fizzy disappearing white head. Aroma is quite bright, sharp woody notes, very woody, nice aged lambic notes, nice menthol, slightly dusty, mild funk, lemon. Taste is tart, nice lemony flavor, very woody, nice rustic character, maybe a bit too woody, lots of oaky tannins, almost vanilla, grapefruit. Palate is dry, med bodied with good carbonation. Nice, certainly different from good old Tilquin.

Draught at Borefts Bier Festival 2014. 
Hazy orange coloured with a small off-white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of barnyard.
Fruity and light acidic flavour of barnyard.
Tart finish.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2014 75cl, Vintage 2011-2013, new exclusive brew Anno 2014, from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex sour brew, sour/woody and slightly fruity/vinous, balanced, cloudy, small head, good brew

Bottle at BBF 6, 26/09/14.
Lightly hazed golden orange with little in the way of a head.
Nose is big tangy citric sours, earthy, musty wood, dry rot, citric tinged straw, lemon rind - to notch.
Taste comprises big lemon tunes, light spice, dank wood, acidic wash, must, grandads shed, citric licks, funked up.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, tarte acidic wash in the close.
Super solid gueuze.

text: 75 cl bottle. Pours cloudy orange, no lasting head. Aroma is wineous, fruity and barnyard. Smooth wooden, fruity and wineous. Lingering fruity and wineous. Smooth fruity and mellow into the finish.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 Re-rate 4/17: Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Tom L. 2011-2013 bottle. Hazy golden. Great barnyard funk, citrus, oak, cobwebs, cellar, sour, light cookie hint, faint sweetish hint, fruits. Medium-bodied. Great and complex. 8/3/8/3/17=3.9

[9/26/14] Bottle sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2014 in Bodegraven. Cloudy orange,. Lovely barnyard aroma with fruits and oak. Sour flavor, quite puckering, funky, oaky, lemony and a bit astringent. Medium-bodied, lively carbonation. 8/3/8/3/16=3.8

Clear blond beer, nice stable white head. Nose is rather intense sourness, quite some oak there as well. Horseblanket. Taste is a bit harsh to begin with but quite pleasant. Somewhat fruity and still very balanced. Already had this multiple times, gets better every single time!
Draft @ Borefts 2014. Wow, this is some sour stuff. Intense taste of brett, horseblanket and some distant old hops. Very, very sour. Tasty though.

From bottle @ Borefts 2014. Golden blonde. Honey, lemon and mango in the aroma. Sour flavor, full bodied. Lemon, oak, honey, hint of yoghurt, Mals. Mango. Complex and slightly alcoholic geuze. I need more of this!

Tap at Borefts 2014. Pours hazy dark orange with thin edges/no head. Aromas of sour apples, vinegar and some yeast. Taste is pretty sour up front, some tart green apples, finishes pretty tart and yeasty. Yum.

12/IX/14 - 37.5cl bottle @ home tasting with Sebletitje - BB: 29/I/24 (2014-990) Thanks to Sebletitje for sharing the bottle!
Clear orange beer, big irregular off-white head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very complex, sour apples, woody, lemon juice, bit fruity. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: soruishs tart, some bitter tannins, lemony, sour apples. Aftertaste: hint of vanilla, sourish, lemony, apple skin, soft bitterness, fruity notes. This aint no punishment!

Bottle pour at Borefts 2014. Pretty solid orange with virtually no head. Aroma is cheese, funk, orange juice, sour peach. Medium-light bodied, tart mouthfeel with a fruity sour and somewhat dry finish. Taste is sour peach, cheddar, orange juice

Almsot headless, golden body. Double aging process or not, I am not overly impressed by this. Dont get me wrong, it is a great lambic and probably an impressive beer for the connaiseur, but I cant see beyong the juicy fruitiness and aged aromas. It is certainly not too sour, in fact it was more dimmed than I wanted. Its okay. Watery mouth feel for the abv. (From bottle at Borefts 2014)

bottle sample at bbf. poured a cloudy amber-ish colour with a white head. citrus, lemon zest, horse blanket, acid, tart, wheat, wow yes, this was good! one hell of a lambic

Bottle sampled at Borefts 2014. Pours hazy golden with no head. Aroma of funk, dank cellar, cobwebs and citrus. Flavour is over moderate acidic. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Bottle @ Borefts 2014, small sample. Clear golden color, short frothy head. Aroma is funky, barnyard, horseblanket, lots of citric notes, slight lactic, bit flowery and grassy, wheat. Medium sour in taste. Medium carbonation. Wonderfully balanced geuze.
Bottle at Borefts. Hazy yellow amber, almost no head. Sour fruity aroma, funky, barnyard. Taste is sour, fruity, funk. Nice.

Bouteille 37.5cl partagée avec Pierre. Beaucoup dattente pour cette Gueuze, surtout après en avoir débouchonné un bon millier. Cette dernière à lalcool plus relevé nen reste pas moins une autre belle production de Tilquin. La couleur reste fidèle à la gueuze de base avec un léger voile doré étant peut-être plus foncé. Un léger trouble est également présent. Le col est généreux, restant crémeux et soyeux dans un ton blanc voire blanc-cassé onctueux. La sursaturation nest plus quun mauvais souvenir, et le visuel est au rendez-vous. 
Au nez, je retrouve, ici encore, une gueuze très rafraichissante même en étant à 7.6%. Ce deuxième passage en fût de chêne nest que tout bénéficie. Des effluves boisées plus prononcées séchappent et offrent un subtil ajout de chêne qui oscille entre léger tanin et un rétro-nasal plus poussé du chêne sans que je puisse y détecter un semblant doxydation. 
Ce bonheur, gustatif, pour le décrire ainsi, se retrouve au niveau du palais qui nest également pas en reste. Cette fois-ci cest du côté du chêne que tout se joue. Je trouve cette deuxième mise en fût tout à lavantage du produit de base. Là où bons nombres de brasseries échouent. Le chêne est nettement plus en avant que sur la Gueuze à lAncienne mais sans être surfait. Le tout reste subtil tout en jouant sur le caractère sec, légèrement suret et effervescent de la gueuze qui est accompagné de pointes fruitées légèrement citronnée et de légers tanins qui accompagnent ce profil de chêne qui rajoute une dimension à la gueuze. A mettre en cave, comme la Gueuze Tilquin une bière qui pour moi gagne en maturité et complexité après une bonne année, voire deux, de cave.
